title: Joint Venture in Infrastructure Projects
description: IHC has launched the Gridora infrastructure platform in collaboration with ADQ and Modon to accelerate strategic infrastructure projects. This presents a lucrative opportunity for firms in the construction and engineering sectors to collaborate on upcoming infrastructure initiatives in the UAE and globally.
example: Construction companies like Arabtec or engineering firms like Atkins could partner with IHC and ADQ to execute major infrastructure projects. This would enhance their portfolio, drive revenue through public sector contracts, and solidify their presence in high-growth markets.
roadmap: Step 1: Identify key infrastructure projects lined up under Gridora.
Step 2: Form partnership agreements with IHC and ADQ.
Step 3: Allocate resources and workforce for project execution.
Step 4: Establish joint marketing strategies to promote the partnership.
Step 5: Monitor project progress and benefits realization.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion

title: Investment in Healthcare Expansion
description: IHC's acquisition of a 60% stake in Hellenic Healthcare Group signals an opportunity for cooperation in the healthcare sector, especially with firms focusing on healthcare technology and services.
example: Health Tech companies like Cerner or Philips could leverage this collaboration to integrate their solutions into Hellenic Healthcare Group's operations, enhancing healthcare delivery and patient outcomes. This would provide IHC with innovative tech integration, while Health Tech firms gain access to the growing European healthcare market.
roadmap: Step 1: Assess the technology needs of Hellenic Healthcare Group.
Step 2: Propose collaborative tech integration projects.
Step 3: Structure partnerships to facilitate exchange of resources and knowledge.
Step 4: Implement pilot projects to demonstrate the effectiveness of innovations.
Step 5: Scale successful projects across the entire network.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion

title: Dirham-Backed Stablecoin Development
description: IHC has initiated the development of a Dirham-backed stablecoin in partnership with ADQ and First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB), providing opportunities for fintech companies to engage in blockchain and digital payment solutions.
example: Fintech startups or established companies like Ripple or BitPay could collaborate with IHC and FAB to facilitate the implementation and promotion of the stablecoin, enhancing digital payment solutions within the UAE and beyond. This is valuable for diversifying payment options and increasing adoption of digital currencies.
roadmap: Step 1: Engage stakeholders and regulatory bodies to discuss stablecoin compliance.
Step 2: Form partnerships with technology providers for digital infrastructure.
Step 3: Develop marketing strategies targeting potential users and businesses.
Step 4: Launch pilot programs and gather user feedback.
Step 5: Officially launch the stablecoin to the broader market.
source_name: IHC Accelerates Growth in Q1 2025 with AED 27.2 Billion Revenue and AED 4.1 Billion Profit, Amid Strategic Portfolio Expansion
